lexUnit.name: similarity_((count)).n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a point of commonality or likeness.

sentence.text: There is a striking similarity between Wolff 's way of talking about children and the views we saw put forward by Hobbes , Locke and Kant .
There are strong similarities to ideals and ways of thought in other English-speaking countries and Western Europe , but only in a broad sense .
Indeed , they both have certain similarities .
There are indeed , as I have already suggested , certain similarities between the two theories , and they have similar powers of deception and similar capacities for making mischief .

Now American producers are tactfully claiming the script is not based on Liz 's life and marriage to builder Larry Fortensky , even though there are striking similarities between her past and the film 's plot .
Unlikely as it may seem , there are striking similarities between the major European languages and Sanskrit .
Despite this conceptual difference , however , there is a close similarity between an ESS and a ` Nash equilibrium " , which is the central equilibrium concept in classical game theory .
Hayek 's epistemological views have certain similarities to those of Oakeshott .
Murray 's death bears similarities to a case two years ago when sixteen year old David Nock was stabbed to death as he jogged home through the town .
This elected committee will have some similarities to the local medical committee and could evolve from it .
The trunk problem has similarities to floppy neck syndrome experienced by European swans which ingested anglers lead shot ( now banned in Britain ) .
Like another graduate of the penal system , Stephen Fry , he acknowledges the similarities between public school and prison .
There were several similarities between the three crashes , the inquiry heard .
We may also discern close similarities between Hayek and Oakeshott on law and government .
Because of the similarities of certain letters , errors in copying could easily creep in .
Words were then categorised based on the similarities of these groups .

Aside from obvious similarities in police riot-control manoeuvres , there was a widespread tendency to use roadblocks , a systematic abuse of the statutory powers of arrest and overlaps in interrogation and intelligence methods .
Similarities in calendars also link the Olmecs and the Mayans .
Tonight the police said they are checking for any similarities with previous attacks .
Indeed , the past history of their relations with the mainland has some similarities with colonialism .
After Kay 's similarity to Clinton was pointed out , she upped his rating from two to six .
The similarities between his personality and career and that of John Major are striking .
Jeff , 38 , has other remarkable similarities to the Italian maestro .
It had some similarities to the Conservative reforms of 1990 .
